intro: Rubia olivieri var. elliptica, commonly known as the olive-rubia or elliptic woodruff, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually hairy and have a distinctive olive-green hue. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five petals with a pale yellow to greenish color. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks.
